title: 'Every Day Is Frightening': Working For Walmart Amid Covid
description: As offices debate the merits and logistics of reopening, a parallel sphere of workers like Peter Naughton, a Walmart cashier, seem to inhabit another world. Often their jobs just got really hard.
dc:creator: Chris Colin
media:credit: Emily Kask for The New York Times
media:description: Peter Naughton is a cashier and self-checkout host in Baton Rouge, La., at Walmart, the country’s largest private employer. He fears going to work — but also the idea of missing it.
